org.javautil.io
Class FileSystemResourceResolver

java.lang.Object
  org.springframework.core.io.DefaultResourceLoader
      org.springframework.core.io.FileSystemResourceLoader
          org.javautil.io.FileSystemResourceResolver
All Implemented Interfaces:
ResourceDirectory, org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean, org.springframework.core.io.ResourceLoader
public class FileSystemResourceResolver
extends org.springframework.core.io.FileSystemResourceLoader
implements ResourceDirectory, org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean

A resource directory for locating files inside of the filesystem. This class resolves resources like the FileSystemResourceLoader class from spring, except that it allows relative file resolution to a root path. This resolver will only return files and directories that return true from the method isHiddenFile. Please note that the url prefixes classpath:// and file:// should not be present in the resource names.

isHiddenFile

protected boolean isHiddenFile(File file,
                               boolean findDirectoriesInsteadOfFiles)
Method for determining whether or not a file should be shown. This is helpful as filesystems in general tend to hide certain files by default, and this behavior is most always often desired from programs.

Parameters:
file -
findDirectoriesInsteadOfFiles -
Returns:
true if hidden

getRootPath

public File getRootPath()
Returns the root path for resolving resources. This is the base directory from which all other resources are relative. Following the Spring convention a leading "/" on a path is ignored.

Returns:
root directory

public void setRootPath(File rootPath)
Assigns a root path for resolving resources.
